page.title: 09Boskenwyn 1913-1927
page.content: Mr Bilkey, born July 21st 1907, lived at Lower Boskenwyn Farm with one brother and one sister until 1972.The farmhouse, built of stone with a Delabole Slate roof in about 1850, is half a mile from Boskenwyn C.P. school.The main crops were grass, dredge corn and straw for thatching. They kept South Devon cows and the machinery was drawn by Shire Horses. Mr.Bilkey started school in 1913. Teachers and children walked to school. The boys wore jerseys and boots and the girls wore white pinafores and had long hair tied with ribbons.There were between 70_100 pupils in three classes:reception and lower juniors in what are now the kitchen and resources area, and top juniors in the big classroom. There were black stoves in the junior rooms and an open fire in the infants.
